subNodes.conversationText: root
[As you enter town, you see Hamfast approach you. He has a troubled look on his face.]
Continue
Eh, it's good to see you. Just in time, , as usual. [Attempting a smile.] Are you one of them now?
Indeed, Hamfast.  I am now a Harper.
Congratulations, I guess.  Though I suppose this means that you'll be facing and causing even more problems than ever.  I've one for you right now, if you'll listen.
Continue
Continue
No--I am a mere Harper Friend, Hamfast, just like you.
Well, I don't know whether to be sorry or to congratulate you--it's not for every <lad/lass> to go mixing <him/her>self up with Harper business.  In any case, we have problems enough as is.
Continue
Continue
Never mind that.  You seem troubled.
It's Brother Anselm.  He's been locked up inside his house for well over a few days.  I just stopped banging on the door myself.  No one's seen him about.  He said he was ill...I fear the worst.
Why don't you go in?
I have a skeleton key for the doors here in town. But--[Lowering his voice]--Manfred and Danmar let me know that Anselm was mixed up with some queer business. It wouldn't be my place...
Continue
I don't think whatever he was involved in had anything to do with the Zhentarim, nor those traitor acolytes of his, either.  That "other" group that Manfred mentioned, maybe.
Continue
Something else. Harper business, not my business. [Hamfast hands you a key.] Take this and find out what's happened to him.
Continue
As I said, I fear he might have killed himself, so be prepared.
What makes you think that Brother Anselm would have done such a thing?

Eh, Danmar and Manfred told me he was...conflicted about something or other. That surprised me. Always seemed like a man at peace with himself to me. Come tell me right away when you find something out.
Continue
Very well.  We will talk again soon.
If he didn't die of illness, I think he might have...done himself in.  Be prepared.  And come tell me right away when you find something out.
Continue
Continue
I don't think whatever he was involved in had anything to do with the Zhentarim, nor those fishy acolytes of his who left a while back.  That "other" group that Manfred mentioned, maybe.
Continue
Continue
What do you want me to do?
Well, I'd like you to go in and investigate.
Continue
Continue
What do you think happened to him?
If he was ill, he could have gotten the fever and died. But he was a healer himself. [Speaking quietly.] I fear he might have done himself in.
Continue
Continue
[Nod.] Go on.
Continue
